channel.title: Graphics Card Help
channel.description:
I want to boost my Minecraft FPS, and I know its because of my GFX card.... So... ATM my computers GFX card is AMD Radeon HD 6520G with 512 MB Graphics System Memory...
And I wanted to buy this one
http://www.amazon.com/EVGA-GeForce-Express-Graphics-01G-P3-1302-LR/dp/B0049MPQA4/ref=sr_1_2?s=pc&ie=UTF8&qid=1358022812&sr=1-2
I guess my question is, how do I know if it'll fit in my computer?

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs

:F I do have a desktop… But I dont use it much.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Kozs:

I have a Laptop. Not Desktop and… is there a link to buy a GTX560?

Uhm, your gpu is most likely soldered to your motherboard… good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Kozs:

I have a Laptop. Not Desktop and… is there a link to buy a GTX560?

You’re not getting that card into a laptop. Adding a card into a laptop is not a simple task, and a lot of laptops wont even support it. You will have to look up your specific laptop model and see if there is a guide for it on the internet.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Look at getting a GTX560 if you can, going dirt cheap and they’ll play any game on high, even BF3 on high at a solid 40 fps

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

It’s pretty much guaranteed to fit if it only requires one slot and the profile is right. If you have a regular size desktop, it’ll be a regular card and if you have a small form factor desktop, it’ll be a low profile. Low profile ones just have a smaller part that sticks out for you to connect your monitors. Worst comes to worst, you can just leave your computer case open - in fact, I’ve done that twice (and am right now). Also, don’t expect that to boost your framerate. It’s about as good as a Radeon HD 3450. Look at http://www.videocardbenchmark.net/high_end_gpus.html (notice the card you want to buy isn’t on that chart and the one you own is) and try eBay. I got a nVidia GeForce GT 240 for $30 and it’s much better than the one you’re looking at. 8400s and 8600s are commonly found and overpriced.

Read full topic
